extracted_data.article_text:
THE DIGITAL PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION ACT, 2023
(NO. 22 OF 2023)
[11th August, 2023.]
An Act to provide for the processing of digital personal data in a manner that
recognises both the right of individuals to protect their personal data and the
need to process such personal data for lawful purposes and for matters
connected therewith or incidental thereto.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Seventy-fourth Year of the Republic of India as
follows:––
CHAPTER I
PRELIMINARY
1. (1) This Act may be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
(2)  It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification
in the Official Gazette, appoint and different dates may be appointed for different provisions
of this Act and any reference in any such provision to the commencement of this Act shall
be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision.
Short title and
commencement.

extracted_data.requirement: This Act shall be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The official title of the Act is the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.

controls.control: Appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO) who is responsible for ensuring compliance with the Act. The DPO should be an employee of the organization and should have the necessary expertise and resources to perform their duties.

Develop and implement a data protection policy that outlines the organization's approach to data protection, including the types of personal data collected, stored, and processed, and the measures in place to protect it.
Obtain explicit consent from data subjects before collecting, storing, or processing their personal data. The consent should be informed, specific, and freely given.
Collect, store, and process only the minimum amount of personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose. Avoid collecting excessive or unnecessary data.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of personal data by implementing procedures for data validation, correction, and deletion.
Establish a data retention policy that outlines the duration for which personal data will be stored and processed. Ensure that data is deleted or anonymized when no longer necessary.

Implement robust security measures to protect personal data from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, modification, or destruction. This includes encryption, access controls, and regular security audits.
Establish procedures for notifying data subjects and regulatory authorities in the event of a data breach. The notification should be timely, accurate, and transparent.
Provide data subjects with access to their personal data upon request. This includes the right to access, correct, or delete their data.
Ensure that personal data is transferred to third-party processors or recipients in accordance with the Act. This includes implementing contracts and agreements that meet the requirements of the Act.
Provide regular training to employees on data protection best practices, including the importance of data protection, data subject rights, and data security measures.

extracted_data.requirement: The Act shall come into force on a date appointed by the Central Government.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Act will come into effect on a date determined by the Central Government, which may vary for different provisions.

controls.control: The Central Government shall define the effective date of the Act in a gazette notification, specifying the date from which the Act shall come into force. This date shall be communicated to all stakeholders, including government departments, regulatory bodies, and the public.

The Central Government shall establish a formal process for notifying the effective date of the Act, including a clear timeline for publication in the gazette and dissemination to relevant stakeholders. This process shall be documented and made available to the public.

The Central Government shall maintain a record of the gazette notification specifying the effective date of the Act, including the date of publication and the relevant gazette number. This record shall be kept for a minimum of 5 years and made available to the public upon request.

controls.control_title: Communicate the Effective Date to Stakeholders
controls.control: The Central Government shall communicate the effective date of the Act to all relevant stakeholders, including government departments, regulatory bodies, and the public, through a variety of channels, including press releases, social media, and official websites.

The Central Government shall provide a transition plan to stakeholders, outlining the steps to be taken to implement the Act from the effective date. This plan shall include timelines, milestones, and key performance indicators.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Establishment of the Data Protection Board of India
extracted_data.requirement: The Central Government shall establish the Data Protection Board of India under section 18.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Central Government is required to establish the Data Protection Board of India, which is a critical component of the data protection framework.

controls.control_title: Establish Data Protection Board of India
controls.control: The Central Government shall establish the Data Protection Board of India under section 18, with clear roles and responsibilities defined for its members. The Board shall be responsible for overseeing the implementation of data protection laws and regulations in the country.

The Central Government shall define clear criteria for selecting members of the Data Protection Board of India, including their qualifications, expertise, and experience in data protection and related fields. The selection process shall be transparent and fair.
The Central Government shall provide the Data Protection Board of India with necessary resources, including funding, personnel, and infrastructure, to enable it to perform its functions effectively.

The Central Government shall establish clear communication channels between the Data Protection Board of India and other stakeholders, including the public, private sector organizations, and other government agencies, to ensure effective collaboration and information sharing.

The Central Government shall develop operational guidelines for the Data Protection Board of India, outlining its procedures, protocols, and decision-making processes. The guidelines shall be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure they remain relevant and effective.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Appointment of a Data Protection Officer
extracted_data.requirement: A Significant Data Fiduciary shall appoint a Data Protection Officer under section 10.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Significant Data Fiduciary is required to appoint a Data Protection Officer to oversee data protection practices and ensure compliance with the Act.

controls.control: The Significant Data Fiduciary shall appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO) who shall be responsible for overseeing the organization's data protection practices and ensuring compliance with relevant data protection laws and regulations. The DPO shall be a senior-level employee with expertise in data protection and shall report directly to the highest level of management.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall define the responsibilities of the Data Protection Officer (DPO) in a written document, including but not limited to, data protection risk management, data subject rights, data breach notification, and compliance with relevant data protection laws and regulations.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall ensure that the Data Protection Officer (DPO) operates independently and is not influenced by business or commercial considerations. The DPO shall have unfettered access to all data processing activities and shall be able to report directly to the highest level of management without fear of retribution.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall provide the Data Protection Officer (DPO) with adequate training and resources to perform their duties effectively. This shall include training on data protection laws and regulations, data protection best practices, and access to relevant tools and technologies.

The Significant Data Fiduciary shall review and update the appointment of the Data Protection Officer (DPO) on a regular basis to ensure that the DPO remains qualified and effective in their role. This shall include reviewing the DPO's expertise, experience, and performance on a regular basis.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Registration of Consent Managers
extracted_data.requirement: A Consent Manager shall be registered with the Board.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Consent Manager is required to be registered with the Board to ensure that they can provide a secure and transparent platform for Data Principals to manage their consent.

controls.control_title: Register Consent Manager with the Board
controls.control: The Consent Manager shall be registered with the Board within 30 days of deployment. This registration shall include all necessary documentation, such as system architecture diagrams and technical specifications.

controls.control_title: Provide Board Access to Consent Manager
controls.control: The Consent Manager shall provide the Board with access to its documentation, including system architecture diagrams, technical specifications, and any other relevant information. This access shall be granted within 14 days of registration.
The Board shall regularly review the Consent Manager's registration to ensure it remains accurate and up-to-date. This review shall be performed at least quarterly, or as needed.

The Consent Manager shall maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation, including system architecture diagrams, technical specifications, and any other relevant information. This documentation shall be readily available to the Board upon request.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Data Fiduciary
extracted_data.requirement: A person shall not determine the purpose and means of processing of personal data without being a Data Fiduciary.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A person is required to be a Data Fiduciary if they determine the purpose and means of processing personal data, which is a critical aspect of data protection.

controls.control: Ensure that all personnel involved in processing personal data are designated as Data Fiduciaries, and that they have the necessary authority and expertise to determine the purpose and means of processing.

Regularly verify the Data Fiduciary status of personnel involved in processing personal data to ensure that they have the necessary authority and expertise to determine the purpose and means of processing.

controls.control_title: Document Data Fiduciary Roles and Responsibilities
controls.control: Maintain up-to-date documentation of Data Fiduciary roles and responsibilities, including their authority and expertise in determining the purpose and means of processing personal data.

controls.control_title: Provide Training on Data Fiduciary Roles
controls.control: Provide regular training to personnel involved in processing personal data on their roles and responsibilities as Data Fiduciaries, including their authority and expertise in determining the purpose and means of processing.
Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized Data Fiduciaries have access to personal data and can determine the purpose and means of processing.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Data Processor
extracted_data.requirement: A person shall not process personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary without being a Data Processor.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A person is required to be a Data Processor if they process personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary, which is a critical aspect of data protection.

controls.control: Verify that any person processing personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary has been designated as a Data Processor by the Data Fiduciary. This can be done by checking the Data Fiduciary's records or by obtaining a written confirmation from the Data Fiduciary.

Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access and process personal data on behalf of the Data Fiduciary. This includes implementing role-based access controls, secure authentication and authorization mechanisms, and regular audits to detect and prevent unauthorized access.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all data processing activities, including the types of personal data processed, the purposes of processing, and the individuals involved in processing. This will help to ensure transparency and accountability in data processing activities.

Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with the requirement that a person shall not process personal data on behalf of a Data Fiduciary without being a Data Processor. This includes reviewing access controls, data processing activities, and records to detect and prevent non-compliance.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Data Principal
extracted_data.requirement: A Data Principal shall be an individual to whom personal data relates.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Data Principal is defined as an individual to whom personal data relates, which is a critical aspect of data protection.

controls.control: Implement a process to verify the identity of individuals who are Data Principals, such as through government-issued ID or other reliable means, to ensure that personal data is only accessed by the correct individual.

controls.control_title: Use Unique Identifiers for Data Principals
controls.control: Assign a unique identifier to each Data Principal, such as a username or account number, to ensure that personal data is linked to the correct individual and to prevent unauthorized access.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of Data Principals, including their contact information and any relevant permissions or access levels, to ensure that personal data is handled correctly and in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Data Principal Requirements
controls.control: Provide regular training to staff on the importance of identifying and handling personal data related to Data Principals, including the procedures for verifying identity and accessing personal data.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Digital Office
extracted_data.requirement: An office shall adopt an online mechanism for conducting proceedings.
extracted_data.requirement_description: An office is required to adopt an online mechanism for conducting proceedings, which is a procedural requirement for efficient and transparent operations.

controls.control: The office shall implement a secure online platform that ensures the integrity and confidentiality of proceedings. This platform shall be designed to prevent unauthorized access, tampering, or data breaches.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Security Audits and Penetration Testing
controls.control: The office shall conduct regular security audits and penetration testing to identify vulnerabilities in the online platform and ensure that they are addressed promptly.

controls.control_title: Establish Clear Guidelines for Online Proceedings
controls.control: The office shall establish clear guidelines for online proceedings, including rules for participation, etiquette, and conduct. These guidelines shall be communicated to all participants and stakeholders.

controls.control_title: Provide Training for Staff and Participants
controls.control: The office shall provide training for staff and participants on the use of the online platform, including how to navigate the system, use features, and troubleshoot common issues.

controls.control_title: Develop a Backup and Recovery Plan
controls.control: The office shall develop a backup and recovery plan to ensure that data is preserved in case of a technical failure or other disaster. This plan shall include procedures for data backup, recovery, and restoration.

The office shall conduct user acceptance testing to ensure that the online platform meets the needs and expectations of participants and stakeholders. This testing shall involve a representative sample of users and stakeholders.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Gain
extracted_data.requirement: A gain in property or supply of services, whether temporary or permanent, shall be considered a gain.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A gain in property or supply of services is considered a gain, which is an administrative item for accounting and financial purposes.

controls.control: Establish a clear policy that defines what constitutes a gain in property or supply of services, including temporary and permanent gains. This policy should be communicated to all relevant stakeholders and employees.

Implement a system to identify and record all gains in property or supply of services, including temporary and permanent gains. This system should be integrated with the accounting and financial reporting processes.
Conduct regular audits to ensure that all gains in property or supply of services are accurately recorded and reported. These audits should be conducted by an independent party to ensure objectivity.

Provide regular training to employees on the policy and procedures for identifying and recording gains in property or supply of services. This training should be provided to all employees who are involved in the accounting and financial reporting processes.

Implement controls to ensure that temporary gains in property or supply of services are properly accounted for and reported. This may include setting up separate accounts or ledgers to track temporary gains.
Review and update the policy on gains in property or supply of services regularly to ensure that it remains relevant and effective. This review should be conducted at least annually or as needed.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Loss
extracted_data.requirement: A loss in property or interruption in supply of services, whether temporary or permanent, shall be considered a loss.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A loss in property or interruption in supply of services is considered a loss, which is an administrative item for accounting and financial purposes.

controls.control: Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential sources of loss or interruption in supply of services. This includes assessing the likelihood and potential impact of natural disasters, equipment failures, and other potential disruptions.

Develop and implement a business continuity plan that outlines procedures for responding to and recovering from losses or interruptions in supply of services. This plan should include emergency contact information, backup systems, and procedures for restoring critical services.

controls.control_title: Maintain Accurate Inventory and Asset Records
controls.control: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all assets, including property and equipment. This will help to quickly identify losses or theft and facilitate the recovery process.

Implement regular maintenance and testing of equipment and systems to prevent failures and minimize downtime. This includes scheduling regular maintenance, conducting regular testing, and addressing any issues promptly.

Document all losses and interventions, including the cause, impact, and response. This will help to identify trends and areas for improvement, and facilitate the development of more effective risk management strategies.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Applicability of the Act
extracted_data.requirement: The Act shall apply to the processing of digital personal data within the territory of India where the personal data is collected.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Act is applicable to the processing of digital personal data collected within India, either in digital or non-digital form.

controls.control: Identify and document the geographic scope of the processing of digital personal data within the territory of India. This includes identifying the regions, states, or cities where personal data is collected, stored, or processed.

Identify and document all points where digital personal data is collected within the territory of India. This includes websites, mobile apps, physical locations, or any other means of data collection.

Monitor and document all transfers of digital personal data outside the territory of India, including international data transfers to third-party countries or organizations. Ensure that such transfers comply with the Act's requirements and applicable international data transfer agreements.

Develop and maintain a data collection policy that outlines the purposes, scope, and procedures for collecting digital personal data within the territory of India. This policy should be communicated to all stakeholders, including employees, customers, and partners.

controls.control_title: Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: Implement data protection by design and default principles in all digital personal data processing activities within the territory of India. This includes ensuring that personal data is collected, stored, and processed in a way that minimizes risks and protects individual rights.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Applicability of the Act outside India
extracted_data.requirement: The Act shall also apply to processing of digital personal data outside the territory of India, if such processing is in connection with any activity related to offering of goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The Act applies to processing of digital personal data outside India if it is related to offering goods or services to individuals within India.

controls.control_title: Data Processing Agreement with Third-Party Vendors
controls.control: Establish a data processing agreement with all third-party vendors that process digital personal data outside the territory of India. The agreement must include provisions for data protection, security, and compliance with Indian data protection laws.

controls.control_title: Risk Assessment for International Data Transfers
controls.control: Conduct a thorough risk assessment for all international data transfers to ensure that they are necessary and proportionate to the offering of goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India. The risk assessment must identify potential risks and implement mitigating controls.

controls.control_title: Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) for International Data Transfers
controls.control: Conduct a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) for all international data transfers that involve the processing of sensitive personal data. The DPIA must identify potential risks and implement mitigating controls to ensure compliance with Indian data protection laws.

Provide regular awareness and training programs for employees who handle digital personal data, including those involved in international data transfers. The training must cover data protection laws, security best practices, and the importance of complying with Indian data protection laws.

controls.control_title: Data Transfer Agreements with International Partners
controls.control: Establish data transfer agreements with international partners that process digital personal data on behalf of the organization. The agreements must include provisions for data protection, security, and compliance with Indian data protection laws.

controls.control_title: Monitoring and Auditing of International Data Transfers
controls.control: Regularly monitor and audit international data transfers to ensure compliance with Indian data protection laws. The monitoring and auditing must include reviews of data transfer agreements, risk assessments, and DPIAs.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Personal Data
extracted_data.requirement: Personal data means any data about an individual who is identifiable by or in relation to such data.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Personal data refers to any information that can be used to identify an individual.

controls.control: Collect only the minimum amount of personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose. This includes limiting the types of data collected and avoiding unnecessary data collection.
Anonymize personal data whenever possible to prevent identification of individuals. This includes using pseudonyms, hashing, or other techniques to remove identifying information.
Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access personal data. This includes using role-based access controls, encryption, and secure authentication mechanisms.

Establish a data retention policy that outlines how long personal data will be stored and when it will be disposed of. This includes implementing secure deletion procedures to prevent unauthorized access to deleted data.

Establish procedures for responding to data subject requests, including the right to access, correct, and erase personal data. This includes providing clear instructions on how to submit requests and responding in a timely manner.

Maintain an inventory of personal data stored by the organization, including the types of data, where it is stored, and who has access to it. This includes regularly reviewing and updating the inventory to ensure accuracy and completeness.

Establish procedures for notifying individuals and regulatory authorities in the event of a data breach. This includes having a clear plan for responding to breaches and communicating with stakeholders in a timely manner.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Personal Data Breach
extracted_data.requirement: A personal data breach means any unauthorised processing of personal data or accidental disclosure, acquisition, sharing, use, alteration, destruction, or loss of access to personal data.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A personal data breach occurs when there is an unauthorised or accidental disclosure, alteration, or loss of access to personal data.

controls.control: Develop and implement an incident response plan that outlines procedures for responding to a personal data breach, including notification to affected individuals and regulatory bodies.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Security Audits and Risk Assessments
controls.control: Conduct regular security audits and risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses in the processing of personal data, and implement measures to mitigate or eliminate these risks.
Provide regular training to personnel on data protection policies and procedures, including the handling of personal data and the procedures to follow in the event of a personal data breach.
Implement access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data, including the use of role-based access controls, encryption, and secure authentication mechanisms.

controls.control_title: Maintain Accurate Records of Personal Data Processing
controls.control: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of personal data processing activities, including the categories of personal data processed, the purposes of processing, and the categories of data subjects affected.
Implement data loss prevention (DLP) measures to detect and prevent unauthorized disclosure, transfer, or loss of personal data, including the use of DLP software and monitoring of data transfers.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Data Protection Impact Assessments
controls.control: Conduct regular data protection impact assessments to identify and mitigate the risks associated with the processing of personal data, including the use of new technologies or processing methods.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Processing
extracted_data.requirement: Processing means a wholly or partly automated operation or set of operations performed on digital personal data.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Processing refers to any automated operation or set of operations performed on digital personal data, including collection, storage, and disclosure.

controls.control: Conduct a thorough impact assessment to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing digital personal data. This includes identifying the type of data being processed, the purpose of processing, and the potential consequences of a data breach.

Only process the minimum amount of personal data necessary to achieve the specified purpose. This includes implementing data retention policies and procedures to ensure data is not stored for longer than necessary.

Implement robust encryption measures to protect digital personal data in transit and at rest. This includes using industry-standard encryption protocols and ensuring that encryption keys are securely managed.

Implement role-based access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to digital personal data. This includes implementing authentication and authorization procedures to prevent unauthorized access.
Implement regular data backups and recovery procedures to ensure that digital personal data can be restored in the event of a data loss or system failure.

Implement procedures for securely disposing of digital personal data when it is no longer needed. This includes using secure deletion methods and ensuring that data is not stored on devices that are discarded or reused.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Significant Data Fiduciary
extracted_data.requirement: A Significant Data Fiduciary is any Data Fiduciary or class of Data Fiduciaries notified by the Central Government under section 10.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A Significant Data Fiduciary is a Data Fiduciary or class of Data Fiduciaries designated by the Central Government under section 10.

controls.control: Establish a process to notify the Central Government under section 10 in case the organization is classified as a Significant Data Fiduciary. This includes registering with the Central Government and obtaining necessary approvals.

Implement a system to classify Data Fiduciaries and identify those that are notified by the Central Government under section 10. This classification should be based on the criteria defined by the Central Government.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of notifications received from the Central Government, including the date of notification, class of Data Fiduciaries, and any subsequent approvals or updates.

Ensure that all Significant Data Fiduciaries comply with the notifications and requirements specified by the Central Government under section 10. This includes implementing necessary policies, procedures, and controls to meet these requirements.
Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on the notification process, classification of Data Fiduciaries, and compliance requirements for Significant Data Fiduciaries.

Conduct regular audits and reviews to ensure compliance with the notification process, classification of Data Fiduciaries, and compliance requirements for Significant Data Fiduciaries. This includes reviewing records, policies, and procedures.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Definition of Specified Purpose
extracted_data.requirement: A specified purpose means the purpose mentioned in the notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal.
extracted_data.requirement_description: A specified purpose refers to the purpose mentioned in the notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal.

controls.control_title: Clearly Define Purpose in Data Notice
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must clearly define the purpose of data collection in the notice given to the Data Principal. This purpose must be specific, concise, and easily understandable by the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary must obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before collecting or processing their data for any purpose other than the one specified in the initial notice. This consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous.
The Data Fiduciary must maintain a record of the purpose for which data is collected and the consent obtained from the Data Principal. This documentation must be easily accessible and up-to-date.

The Data Fiduciary must regularly review and update the purpose for which data is collected to ensure it remains relevant and accurate. This review must be conducted at least annually or whenever there is a change in the purpose.

The Data Fiduciary must provide transparency to the Data Principal on the purpose for which their data is being collected and processed. This transparency must be provided in a clear and concise manner, and must include information on how the data is being used.

extracted_data.requirement_title: Personal Data Processing for Lawful Purpose
extracted_data.article_text:
4 THE GAZETTE OF INDIA EXTRAORDINARY [P ART II—
(c) not apply to—
(i) personal data processed by an individual for any personal or domestic
purpose; and
(ii) personal data that is made or caused to be made publicly available
by—
(A) the Data Principal to whom such personal data relates; or
(B) any other person who is under an obligation under any law for
the time being in force in India to make such personal data publicly
available.
Illustration.
X, an individual, while blogging her views, has publicly made available her personal
data on social media. In such case, the provisions of this Act shall not apply.
CHAPTER II
OBLIGATIONS OF DATA FIDUCIARY
4. (1) A person may process the personal data of a Data Principal only in accordance
with the provisions of this Act and for a lawful purpose,—
(a) for which the Data Principal has given her consent; or
(b) for certain legitimate uses.
(2) For the purposes of this section, the expression “lawful purpose” means any
purpose which is not expressly forbidden by law.
5. (1) Every request made to a Data Principal under section 6 for consent shall be
accompanied or preceded by a notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal,
informing her,—
  (i) the personal data and the purpose for which the same is proposed to be
processed;
  (ii) the manner in which she may exercise her rights under sub-section (4) of
section 6 and section 13; and
 (iii) the manner in which the Data Principal may make a complaint to the Board,
in such manner and as may be prescribed.
Illustration.
X, an individual, opens a bank account using the mobile app or website of Y , a bank.
To complete the Know-Your-Customer requirements under law for opening of bank account,
X opts for processing of her personal data by Y in a live, video-based customer identification
process. Y shall accompany or precede the request for the personal data with notice to X,
describing the personal data and the purpose of its processing.
(2) Where a Data Principal has given her consent for the processing of her personal
data before the date of commencement of this Act,—
(a) the Data Fiduciary shall, as soon as it is reasonably practicable, give to the
Data Principal a notice informing her,––
(i) the personal data and the purpose for which the same has been

controls.control_title: Define Lawful Purpose Before Data Collection
controls.control: Before collecting personal data, the organization must define the lawful purpose for processing the data. This purpose must be specific, legitimate, and aligned with the organization's goals. The purpose must be documented and communicated to all personnel involved in data processing.

When processing personal data for a new purpose, the organization must obtain explicit consent from the data subject. This consent must be informed, specific, and freely given. The organization must provide clear and concise information about the purpose, scope, and duration of the processing.

controls.control: The organization must maintain accurate and up-to-date records of the purpose and scope of personal data processing. This documentation must include the lawful basis for processing, the categories of data processed, and the duration of the processing.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Purpose of Processing
controls.control: The organization must regularly review and update the purpose of personal data processing to ensure it remains lawful and aligned with the organization's goals. This review must be conducted at least annually or whenever there is a change in the purpose or scope of processing.

controls.control_title: Notice to Data Principal Before Processing Personal Data
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall provide a clear and concise notice to the Data Principal before processing their personal data for consent. This notice shall include information about the purpose of data processing, the types of data to be processed, and the duration for which the data will be stored.

The notice to the Data Principal shall be provided at the earliest opportunity before processing their personal data for consent. This ensures that the Data Principal is aware of the data processing activities and can provide informed consent.

The notice to the Data Principal shall include the following information: (1) a clear statement of the purpose of data processing, (2) a description of the types of personal data to be processed, (3) an explanation of how the data will be used, (4) information about the duration for which the data will be stored, and (5) contact information for the Data Fiduciary.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of the notice provided to the Data Principal, including the date and time of notice provision, the content of the notice, and the response from the Data Principal (if any). This record shall be retained for a period of at least 5 years.

controls.control: Implement an automated system to generate and send notices to Data Principals about existing personal data processing. This system should be able to retrieve relevant data processing information from the Data Fiduciary's systems and generate a notice in a timely manner.

Maintain an up-to-date inventory of all personal data processing activities, including the purpose, scope, and duration of each processing activity. This inventory should be used to generate accurate and timely notices to Data Principals.

Establish clear guidelines for the content and format of notices to Data Principals, including the required information to be included and the manner in which the notice should be presented. This will ensure consistency and clarity in the notices provided to Data Principals.

Establish a reliable and secure mechanism for delivering notices to Data Principals, such as email or postal mail. This mechanism should be able to handle large volumes of notices and ensure timely delivery.

Implement a mechanism to track and record acknowledgement of notices received by Data Principals, such as a checkbox or a confirmation email. This will help the Data Fiduciary to verify that the notice was received and understood by the Data Principal.

Establish a retention policy for notices sent to Data Principals, including the duration for which the notice should be retained and the manner in which it should be stored. This will ensure that the Data Fiduciary can demonstrate compliance with the notice requirement.

extracted_data.requirement_description: Personal data cannot be processed without the Data Principal's consent or a lawful purpose.

controls.control: Ensure that explicit consent is obtained from individuals before processing their personal data. This can be done through clear and concise language in data collection forms, website pop-ups, or other means. Consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous.

Clearly define the purpose for which personal data will be processed and ensure that it aligns with the organization's legitimate interests. This purpose must be specific, transparent, and communicated to individuals whose data is being processed.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs)
controls.control: Conduct regular DPIAs to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing personal data. This includes assessing the likelihood and potential impact of data breaches, unauthorized access, or other security incidents.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of personal data processing activities, including consent obtained, purposes defined, and data subjects' rights exercised. This ensures transparency and accountability in data processing activities.

controls.control_title: Implement Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: Implement data protection by design and default principles in all data processing activities. This includes considering data protection requirements from the outset, implementing technical and organizational measures to ensure data protection, and minimizing data collection and processing to only what is necessary.

extracted_data.requirement_description: A Data Fiduciary must inform the Data Principal about how to exercise her rights and make a complaint to the Board.

controls.control_title: Clear and Prominent Disclosure of Rights
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall clearly and prominently disclose to the Data Principal her rights, including but not limited to, the right to access, correct, and delete her personal data, and the right to opt-out of data processing. This disclosure shall be made in a manner that is easily accessible and understandable by the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary shall clearly and prominently disclose to the Data Principal the procedure for submitting complaints regarding data processing, including but not limited to, the contact information of the Data Protection Officer (DPO) or the designated complaint handling body. This disclosure shall be made in a manner that is easily accessible and understandable by the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary shall provide the Data Principal with a mechanism to access and correct her personal data, including but not limited to, the right to request a copy of her personal data, the right to request correction of inaccurate or incomplete personal data, and the right to request erasure of personal data. This mechanism shall be easily accessible and understandable by the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary shall provide the Data Principal with a mechanism to opt-out of data processing, including but not limited to, the right to request that her personal data not be processed for marketing purposes, the right to request that her personal data not be shared with third parties, and the right to request that her personal data not be used for any other purpose. This mechanism shall be easily accessible and understandable by the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all complaints received from the Data Principal regarding data processing, including but not limited to, the date and time of receipt, the nature of the complaint, and the outcome of the complaint. This record shall be kept for a period of at least 5 years and shall be made available to the relevant authorities upon request.

controls.control: Use simple and clear language in the consent form to ensure that the Data Principal understands the purpose and scope of data collection, processing, and sharing. Avoid using technical jargon or complex terminology that may confuse the Data Principal.

Obtain specific consent from the Data Principal for each purpose of data collection, processing, and sharing. This includes obtaining separate consent for each type of data collected, processed, or shared.

Provide the Data Principal with all necessary information about the data collection, processing, and sharing, including the types of data collected, the purposes of collection, processing, and sharing, and the risks associated with data processing. This information should be presented in a clear and concise manner.

Ensure that the consent given by the Data Principal is unconditional, meaning that it is not tied to any specific conditions or requirements. The Data Principal should be free to withdraw their consent at any time without facing any negative consequences.

Ensure that the consent given by the Data Principal is unambiguous, meaning that it is clear and unmistakable. This can be achieved by using clear and specific language, avoiding ambiguity, and ensuring that the Data Principal understands the implications of their consent.

Implement a consent mechanism that allows the Data Principal to provide their consent in a secure and reliable manner. This can include using digital signatures, encryption, or other secure methods to ensure the integrity and authenticity of the consent.

Maintain a record of the consent given by the Data Principal, including the date, time, and details of the consent. This record should be secure, accurate, and easily accessible for auditing and compliance purposes.

Notify the Data Principal of any changes to the data collection, processing, or sharing purposes, including any new purposes or changes to existing purposes. This notification should be clear, concise, and timely, and should provide the Data Principal with an opportunity to withdraw their consent if they wish to do so.

Implement an automated process for withdrawing consent, where possible. This will help to ensure that withdrawal requests are processed quickly and efficiently.

controls.control_title: Clear Communication of Consent Withdrawal Consequences
controls.control: Clearly communicate to the Data Principal the consequences of withdrawing consent, including any potential impact on the services or benefits they receive, in a transparent and easily understandable manner.

Obtain informed consent from the Data Principal at the time of onboarding, including a clear explanation of the consequences of withdrawing consent, to ensure they are aware of the implications before providing their data.
Maintain a record of the consequences of withdrawing consent, including any potential impact on the services or benefits, to ensure transparency and accountability in case of any disputes or issues.

controls.control_title: Regular Review and Update of Consent Terms
controls.control: Regularly review and update the consent terms to ensure they accurately reflect the consequences of withdrawing consent, and communicate any changes to the Data Principal in a timely manner.

controls.control_title: Training for Staff on Consent Withdrawal Consequences
controls.control: Provide regular training to staff on the consequences of withdrawing consent, to ensure they are aware of the implications and can communicate them effectively to the Data Principal.

controls.control: Automate the process of ceasing data processing upon consent withdrawal to ensure timely compliance. This can be achieved through the implementation of APIs or webhooks that trigger data processing cessation when consent is withdrawn.

controls.control_title: Establish a Consent Withdrawal Notification Process
controls.control: Develop a notification process to inform the Data Fiduciary and relevant stakeholders when consent is withdrawn. This will ensure that all parties are aware of the need to cease data processing in a timely manner.

controls.control: Establish a clear and reasonable timeframe for ceasing data processing after consent withdrawal. This timeframe should be communicated to all stakeholders and included in relevant policies and procedures.

Maintain up-to-date documentation of consent withdrawal procedures, including the steps taken to cease data processing and the notification process. This will ensure that all stakeholders are aware of the procedures and can follow them in the event of a consent withdrawal.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Audits to Ensure Compliance
controls.control: Regularly audit data processing activities to ensure that consent withdrawal is handled in accordance with the established procedures. This will help identify any gaps or areas for improvement and ensure ongoing compliance.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must specify the purpose for which the Data Principal's personal data will be processed at the time of data collection. This purpose must be clearly communicated to the Data Principal and must not be used for any other purpose without the Data Principal's consent.
The Data Fiduciary must obtain explicit consent from the Data Principal before processing their personal data for any purpose. This consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous.

The Data Fiduciary must use data collection forms that clearly specify the purpose for which the personal data will be processed. These forms must be easily accessible and understandable to the Data Principal.

The Data Fiduciary must review and update the purpose for which the Data Principal's personal data is being processed at regular intervals (e.g., annually). This review must be documented and must include any changes to the purpose or the Data Principal's consent.

The Data Fiduciary must ensure that only authorized personnel have access to the Data Principal's personal data and that access is limited to the minimum necessary for the specified purpose. The Data Fiduciary must also establish a retention period for the personal data and must ensure that it is deleted or anonymized after the retention period has expired.

extracted_data.requirement: The State and its instrumentalities may process personal data for providing subsidies, benefits, services, certificates, licenses, or permits.
extracted_data.requirement_description: The State and its instrumentalities can process personal data for providing specified services, subject to consent and standards.

controls.control: Only collect and process personal data that is necessary for providing subsidies, benefits, services, certificates, licenses, or permits. Ensure that the data collected is relevant, accurate, and up-to-date.

Clearly specify the purpose of collecting and processing personal data for each subsidy, benefit, service, certificate, license, or permit. Ensure that the purpose is transparent and communicated to the data subject.

Obtain explicit consent from data subjects before collecting and processing their personal data for providing subsidies, benefits, services, certificates, licenses, or permits. Ensure that consent is informed, specific, and freely given.

controls.control_title: Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: Implement data protection by design and default principles when developing and deploying systems for processing personal data. Ensure that data protection is integrated into the design and default settings of these systems.

Establish a data retention and disposal policy for personal data collected for providing subsidies, benefits, services, certificates, licenses, or permits. Ensure that data is retained for the minimum period necessary and disposed of securely when no longer needed.

Implement access control and authorization mechanisms to ensure that only authorized personnel can access and process personal data. Ensure that access is granted based on job function and need-to-know principles.

Implement robust data security measures to protect personal data from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, modification, or destruction. Ensure that data is encrypted, backed up regularly, and protected against cyber threats.

controls.control_title: Automated Deletion of Emailing Bill Processing

controls.control_title: Manual Verification of Emailing Bill Processing Cessation
controls.control: Establish a manual verification process to ensure that the processing of personal data of Z for emailing bills has been ceased. This process should involve regular checks and audits to confirm compliance with the requirement.

controls.control_title: Notification of Emailing Bill Processing Cessation
controls.control: Develop a notification process to inform relevant stakeholders, including Z, that the processing of their personal data for emailing bills has been ceased. This notification should be provided in a timely manner and in accordance with applicable data protection regulations.

controls.control_title: Documentation of Emailing Bill Processing Cessation
controls.control: Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation to record the cessation of processing personal data of Z for emailing bills. This documentation should include details of the process, timelines, and any relevant evidence of compliance.

controls.control_title: Review and Update Emailing Bill Processing Cessation
controls.control: Regularly review and update the process for ceasing the processing of personal data of Z for emailing bills to ensure it remains effective and compliant with changing regulations and requirements.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all notices sent to Data Principals, including the date, time, and content of the notice. This record shall be stored securely and be accessible for a minimum of 5 years.

The Data Fiduciary shall implement a mechanism to prove that a notice was delivered to the Data Principal, such as email receipts or delivery confirmations. This proof shall be stored securely and be accessible for a minimum of 5 years.
The Data Fiduciary shall implement an acknowledgement mechanism for Data Principals to confirm receipt of the notice. This mechanism shall be easy to use and provide a clear indication of receipt.
The Data Fiduciary shall establish a retention policy for notices, including the minimum and maximum retention periods. This policy shall be documented and communicated to all relevant personnel.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain an audit trail of all notices sent to Data Principals, including the date, time, and content of the notice. This audit trail shall be used to investigate any discrepancies or complaints related to notice delivery.

Certain
legitimate uses.
extracted_data.requirement: Personal data shall be processed for legitimate purposes, including determining eligibility for government benefits.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Organizations must process personal data only for specific, legitimate purposes, such as determining eligibility for government benefits, and must obtain consent from the individual for such processing.

controls.control_title: Define Clear and Legitimate Purpose for Processing Personal Data
controls.control: Establish a clear and documented purpose for processing personal data, including determining eligibility for government benefits. This purpose should be specific, legitimate, and aligned with the organization's goals and objectives. Ensure that all stakeholders, including employees and third-party vendors, understand the purpose and scope of personal data processing.

Conduct regular impact assessments to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with processing personal data for determining eligibility for government benefits. This includes assessing the likelihood and potential impact of data breaches, unauthorized access, or other security incidents.

Implement data minimization principles to ensure that only the minimum amount of personal data necessary for determining eligibility for government benefits is collected, stored, and processed. This includes implementing data retention policies and procedures to ensure that personal data is not retained for longer than necessary.

controls.control_title: Provide Transparency and Notice to Individuals
controls.control: Provide transparency and notice to individuals about the collection, use, and disclosure of their personal data for determining eligibility for government benefits. This includes providing clear and concise language in privacy notices, data protection policies, and other relevant documents.

controls.control_title: Train Employees on Data Protection Principles
controls.control: Train employees on data protection principles, including the importance of processing personal data for legitimate purposes. Ensure that employees understand their roles and responsibilities in protecting personal data and are aware of the consequences of non-compliance.

extracted_data.requirement: Personal data shall be processed for legitimate uses, including determining eligibility for other government benefits.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Organizations must process personal data only for legitimate purposes, such as determining eligibility for other government benefits, and must ensure that such processing is necessary and proportionate to the purpose.

controls.control: Establish a clear and concise purpose statement for collecting personal data, including the specific government benefits for which eligibility will be determined. This purpose statement must be communicated to data subjects prior to data collection.

Only collect and process personal data that is necessary for determining eligibility for other government benefits. Avoid collecting excessive or unnecessary data that may not be relevant to the purpose.
Obtain explicit consent from data subjects prior to processing their personal data for determining eligibility for other government benefits. Consent must be informed, specific, and freely given.
Implement access controls and authorization procedures to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to personal data for determining eligibility for other government benefits.

Establish a data retention and disposal policy for personal data collected for determining eligibility for other government benefits. Personal data must be retained for a specified period and then disposed of securely.

Conduct a DPIA to assess the risks associated with processing personal data for determining eligibility for other government benefits. The DPIA must identify and mitigate any potential risks to data subjects.

extracted_data.article_text:
SEC. 1] THE GAZETTE OF INDIA EXTRAORDINARY 7
(c) for the performance by the State or any of its instrumentalities of any function
under any law for the time being in force in India or in the interest of sovereignty and
integrity of India or security of the State;
(d) for fulfilling any obligation under any law for the time being in force in India
on any person to disclose any information to the State or any of its instrumentalities,
subject to such processing being in accordance with the provisions regarding
disclosure of such information in any other law for the time being in force;
(e) for compliance with any judgment or decree or order issued under any law
for the time being in force in India, or any judgment or order relating to claims of a
contractual or civil nature under any law for the time being in force outside India;
(f) for responding to a medical emergency involving a threat to the life or
immediate threat to the health of the Data Principal or any other individual;
 (g) for taking measures to provide medical treatment or health services to any
individual during an epidemic, outbreak of disease, or any other threat to public
health;
(h) for taking measures to ensure safety of, or provide assistance or services to,
any individual during any disaster, or any breakdown of public order.
Explanation.— For the purposes of this clause, the expression “disaster” shall
have the same meaning as assigned to it in clause ( d) of section 2 of the Disaster
Management Act, 2005; or
(i) for the purposes of employment or those related to safeguarding the employer
from loss or liability, such as prevention of corporate espionage, maintenance of

The Data Fiduciary shall monitor compliance with the provisions of this Act and the rules made thereunder and report any non-compliance to senior management and the Board of Directors. The Data Fiduciary shall also report any non-compliance to regulatory authorities as required by law.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary must engage a Data Processor under a valid contract that includes provisions for data protection, confidentiality, and security. The contract must be signed by authorized representatives of both parties and must be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance with changing regulatory requirements.

The contract with the Data Processor must include specific requirements for data protection, such as data encryption, access controls, and incident response procedures. The contract must also specify the responsibilities of each party in the event of a data breach or other security incident.

controls.control_title: Contractual Requirements for Data Storage and Processing
controls.control: The contract with the Data Processor must specify the requirements for data storage and processing, including the location of data storage, data retention periods, and the procedures for data destruction or disposal.

controls.control_title: Contractual Requirements for Data Access and Use
controls.control: The contract with the Data Processor must specify the requirements for data access and use, including the procedures for granting access to authorized personnel, the use of data for authorized purposes only, and the procedures for revoking access when it is no longer needed.

controls.control_title: Contractual Requirements for Termination and Dispute Resolution
controls.control: The contract with the Data Processor must specify the procedures for termination of the contract, including the notice period, termination fees, and dispute resolution mechanisms. This will help ensure a smooth transition of data and services in the event of a contract termination.

extracted_data.requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall ensure the completeness, accuracy, and consistency of personal data.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries must ensure that personal data is complete, accurate, and consistent, especially when making decisions or disclosing data to other Data Fiduciaries.

controls.control: Implement data validation and verification processes to ensure that personal data is accurate, complete, and consistent. This includes using data quality checks, data profiling, and data reconciliation to identify and correct errors or inconsistencies.

Standardize and normalize personal data to ensure consistency across different systems and processes. This includes using standardized formats, data dictionaries, and data mapping to ensure that data is accurately and consistently represented.

Establish a data quality monitoring and reporting process to track and report on data accuracy, completeness, and consistency. This includes using data quality metrics, dashboards, and alerts to identify and address data quality issues in a timely manner.

Provide regular training and awareness programs for employees on data quality best practices, data validation and verification processes, and data standardization and normalization procedures. This includes educating employees on the importance of data quality and their roles and responsibilities in maintaining data accuracy, completeness, and consistency.

Establish a data governance framework that outlines roles, responsibilities, and accountability for data quality, including data validation and verification, data standardization and normalization, and data quality monitoring and reporting. This includes designating a data steward or data quality officer to oversee data quality initiatives and ensure accountability for data quality issues.

controls.control: Implement access control measures to ensure that only authorized personnel have access to sensitive data and systems. This includes multi-factor authentication, role-based access control, and regular review of user permissions.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Security Audits and Risk Assessments
controls.control: Conduct regular security audits and risk assessments to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses in the system. This includes penetration testing, vulnerability scanning, and risk assessments to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities.
Implement data encryption to protect sensitive data both in transit and at rest. This includes encrypting data stored on servers, databases, and in transit over the network.

controls.control_title: Develop and Implement Incident Response Plan
controls.control: Develop and implement an incident response plan to respond to security incidents and data breaches. This includes procedures for containment, eradication, recovery, and post-incident activities.

Provide regular security awareness training to employees to educate them on security best practices, phishing attacks, and other security threats. This includes training on password management, data protection, and incident response.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of security-related activities, including security audits, risk assessments, and incident response activities. This includes maintaining records of access control, user permissions, and system configurations.

extracted_data.requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall protect personal data with reasonable security safeguards.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries must protect personal data with reasonable security measures to prevent breaches.

controls.control: All personal data must be encrypted both in transit and at rest. This includes data stored on servers, databases, and any other storage devices. Encryption algorithms such as AES-256 must be used, and encryption keys must be securely stored and managed.

controls.control_title: Use Secure Protocols for Data Transmission
controls.control: All data transmission must use secure protocols such as HTTPS, SFTP, or SSH. This includes data transmitted between systems, applications, and users. All data in transit must be encrypted and authenticated to prevent eavesdropping and tampering.

All systems, applications, and data must have robust access controls and authentication mechanisms in place. This includes multi-factor authentication, role-based access control, and least privilege access. Access controls must be regularly reviewed and updated to ensure they remain effective.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Security Audits and Risk Assessments
controls.control: Regular security audits and risk assessments must be conducted to identify and mitigate potential security risks. This includes vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, and risk assessments. Results must be documented and addressed to ensure the security of personal data.

An incident response plan must be implemented to respond to security incidents and data breaches. This includes procedures for containment, eradication, recovery, and post-incident activities. The plan must be regularly reviewed and updated to ensure it remains effective.

All employees must receive regular data protection training to ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in protecting personal data. This includes training on data handling, storage, and transmission best practices.

controls.control: Develop and implement a data erasure process that can be triggered upon withdrawal of consent or as required by the Act. This process should ensure that all personal data is completely erased from the system, including backups and archives.

Establish a procedure to identify and erase personal data stored in various systems, databases, and storage media. This includes data stored in cloud services, on-premises servers, and other data repositories.

controls.control_title: Notify Data Subjects of Data Erasure
controls.control: Develop a notification process to inform data subjects that their personal data has been erased upon withdrawal of consent or as required by the Act. This notification should be provided in a timely manner and in accordance with the Act's requirements.

Maintain records of data erasure activities, including the date, time, and method of erasure. This documentation will help demonstrate compliance with the Act and provide evidence of data erasure in case of any disputes or audits.

Provide regular training to personnel on the data erasure process, including the procedures for identifying and erasing personal data, notifying data subjects, and documenting data erasure activities. This training will ensure that personnel understand their roles and responsibilities in ensuring compliance with the Act.

controls.control: Develop and implement a secure API that allows Data Principals to withdraw their consent and initiate data deletion. The API should be accessible via a secure channel (e.g., HTTPS) and should include authentication and authorization mechanisms to ensure only authorized Data Principals can initiate data deletion.

Implement an automated process to erase personal data from all systems and storage devices upon receipt of a data deletion request. This process should be triggered by the Data Deletion API and should include logging and auditing mechanisms to ensure data deletion is properly recorded.

controls.control_title: Notify Data Principals of Data Deletion
controls.control: Develop a notification system to inform Data Principals that their personal data has been deleted. This notification should be sent via a secure channel (e.g., email or secure messaging) and should include a confirmation of data deletion and any relevant next steps.

Maintain a record of the data deletion process, including the steps taken to erase personal data and the systems and storage devices affected. This documentation should be accessible to authorized personnel and should be reviewed regularly to ensure compliance with the data deletion requirement.

Implement a verification process to ensure that personal data has been properly erased from all systems and storage devices. This process should include regular audits and testing to ensure data deletion is complete and accurate.

(b) cause its Data Processor to erase any personal data that was made available
by the Data Fiduciary for processing to such Data Processor.
Illustrations.
(I) X, an individual, registers herself on an online marketplace operated by Y , an
e-commerce service provider. X gives her consent to Y for the processing of her personal
data for selling her used car. The online marketplace helps conclude the sale. Y shall no
longer retain her personal data.
(II) X, an individual, decides to close her savings account with Y , a bank. Y is required
by law applicable to banks to maintain the record of the identity of its clients for a period of
ten years beyond closing of accounts. Since retention is necessary for compliance with law,
Y shall retain X’s personal data for the said period.
(8) The purpose referred to in clause  (a) of sub-section  (7) shall be deemed to no
longer be served, if the Data Principal does not––
(a) approach the Data Fiduciary for the performance of the specified purpose;
and
(b) exercise any of her rights in relation to such processing,
for such time period as may be prescribed, and different time periods may be prescribed for
different classes of Data Fiduciaries and for different purposes.
(9) A Data Fiduciary shall publish, in such manner as may be prescribed, the business
contact information of a Data Protection Officer, if applicable, or a person who is able to
answer on behalf of the Data Fiduciary, the questions, if any, raised by the Data Principal
about the processing of her personal data.
(10) A Data Fiduciary shall establish an effective mechanism to redress the grievances
of Data Principals.
(11) For the purposes of this section, it is hereby clarified that a Data Principal shall be
considered as not having approached the Data Fiduciary for the performance of the specified
purpose, in any period during which she has not initiated contact with the Data Fiduciary
for such performance, in person or by way of communication in electronic or physical form.
9. (1) The Data Fiduciary shall, before processing any personal data of a child or a
person with disability who has a lawful guardian obtain verifiable consent of the parent of
such child or the lawful guardian, as the case may be, in such manner as may be prescribed.
Explanation.—For the purpose of this sub-section, the expression “consent  of the
parent” includes the consent of lawful guardian, wherever applicable.
(2) A Data Fiduciary shall not undertake such processing of personal data that is
likely to cause any detrimental effect on the well-being of a child.
(3) A Data Fiduciary shall not undertake tracking or behavioural monitoring of children
or targeted advertising directed at children.
(4) The provisions of sub-sections (1) and (3) shall not be applicable to processing of
personal data of a child by such classes of Data Fiduciaries or for such purposes, and
subject to such conditions, as may be prescribed.
(5) The Central Government may, if satisfied that a Data Fiduciary has ensured that its
processing of personal data of children is done in a manner that is verifiably safe, notify for
such processing by such Data Fiduciary the age above which that Data Fiduciary shall be
exempt from the applicability of all or any of the obligations under sub-sections (1) and (3)
extracted_data.requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall erase personal data when the specified purpose is no longer being served.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries must delete personal data when it is no longer needed for its original purpose.

controls.control: Establish and enforce data retention policies that clearly define the purpose and duration for which personal data is stored. This includes setting specific timeframes for data deletion or archiving after the purpose is no longer served.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Data Retention Policies
controls.control: Schedule regular reviews of data retention policies to ensure they remain relevant and effective. Update policies as necessary to reflect changes in business needs or regulatory requirements.

Create procedures for erasing personal data when the specified purpose is no longer being served. This includes identifying the types of data to be erased, the methods for erasure, and the personnel responsible for implementing the procedures.

controls.control_title: Train Personnel on Data Erasure Procedures
controls.control: Provide training to personnel on the procedures for erasing personal data when the specified purpose is no longer being served. This includes educating personnel on the importance of data erasure and the consequences of non-compliance.

Implement monitoring and logging mechanisms to track data erasure activities. This includes tracking the types of data erased, the methods used for erasure, and the personnel responsible for implementing the procedures.

extracted_data.requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall retain personal data for a period as required by law.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries must keep personal data for as long as required by law, even if the original purpose is no longer being served.

controls.control: Develop and implement a retention schedule that outlines the minimum and maximum retention periods for personal data as required by law. This schedule should be reviewed and updated regularly to ensure compliance with changing regulations.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of the retention periods for personal data, including the legal basis for retention and the procedures for disposal or deletion of data when the retention period expires.

Provide regular training to personnel on the importance of data retention and the procedures for handling personal data, including the retention periods and procedures for disposal or deletion of data.
Regularly monitor and review the retention periods for personal data to ensure compliance with the established retention schedule and to identify any potential issues or risks.
Establish procedures for the secure disposal or deletion of personal data when the retention period expires, including the use of secure deletion methods and the verification of data destruction.

extracted_data.requirement: A Data Principal shall approach the Data Fiduciary for the performance of the specified purpose.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Data Principals must contact the Data Fiduciary to perform the specified purpose.

controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall establish a notification process for Data Principals to request the performance of a specified purpose. This process shall include a clear and concise method for Data Principals to submit their requests, such as an online form or email address.

The Data Fiduciary shall establish a reasonable timeframe for responding to Data Principal requests, including a maximum number of days for acknowledgement and a maximum number of days for completion of the specified purpose.

The Data Fiduciary shall maintain a record of all Data Principal requests, including the date and time of receipt, the purpose requested, and the outcome of the request. This record shall be accessible to Data Principals upon request.

The Data Fiduciary shall be accountable for ensuring that all Data Principal requests are processed in accordance with the specified purpose and applicable laws and regulations. The Data Fiduciary shall maintain records of all requests and responses, and shall be able to demonstrate compliance with this requirement upon request.

extracted_data.requirement: A Data Fiduciary shall publish its business contact information.
extracted_data.requirement_description: Data Fiduciaries must make their business contact information publicly available.

controls.control_title: Publish Business Contact Information on Website
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall publish its business contact information, including name, address, phone number, and email address, on its official website in a prominent and easily accessible location.
The Data Fiduciary shall regularly verify its business contact information to ensure its accuracy and completeness.
The Data Fiduciary shall provide multiple channels for individuals to contact the organization, including phone, email, and physical address.

controls.control_title: Update Business Contact Information on Social Media
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall update its business contact information on its official social media accounts to ensure consistency across all platforms.

controls.control_title: Make Business Contact Information Easily Discoverable
controls.control: The Data Fiduciary shall make its business contact information easily discoverable through search engines and other online directories.
